Generation III.Ruby: Normally, Whismur 's voice is very quiet - it is barely audible even if one is paying close attention. However, if this Pok é mon senses danger, it starts crying at an earsplitting volume.
Generation III.Sapphire: Whismur is very timid. If it starts to cry loudly, it becomes startled by its own crying and cries even harder. When it finally stops crying, the Pok é mon goes to sleep, all tired out.
Generation III.Emerald: Its cries equal a jet plane in volume. It inhales through its ear canals. Because of this system, it can cry continually without having to catch its breath.
Generation III.FireRed: It usually murmurs, but starts crying loudly if it senses danger. It stops when its ear covers are shut.
Generation III.LeafGreen: It usually murmurs, but starts crying loudly if it senses danger. It stops when its ear covers are shut.

Generation IV.Diamond: Usually, its cries are like quiet murmurs. If frightened, it shrieks at the same volume as a jet plane.
Generation IV.Pearl: Usually, its cries are like quiet murmurs. If frightened, it shrieks at the same volume as a jet plane.
Generation IV.Platinum: Usually, its cries are like quiet murmurs. If frightened, it shrieks at the same volume as a jet plane.
Generation IV.HeartGold: If it senses danger, it scares the foe by crying out with the volume of a jet-plane engine.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: If it senses danger, it scares the foe by crying out with the volume of a jet-plane engine.

Generation VI.X: It usually murmurs but starts crying loudly if it senses danger. It stops when its ear covers are shut.
Generation VI.Y: If it senses danger, it scares the foe by crying out with the volume of a jet-plane engine.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Normally, Whismur's voice is very quiet—it is barely audible even if one is paying close attention. However, if this Pokémon senses danger, it starts crying at an earsplitting volume.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Whismur is very timid. If it starts to cry loudly, it becomes startled by its own crying and cries even harder. When it finally stops crying, the Pokémon goes to sleep, all tired out.

Generation VIII.Sword: The cry of a Whismur is over 100 decibels. If you're close to a Whismur when it lets out a cry, you'll be stuck with an all-day headache.
Generation VIII.Shield: When Whismur cries, the sound of its own voice startles it, making the Pokémon cry even louder. It cries until its exhausted, then it falls asleep.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Usually, its cries are like quiet murmurs. If frightened, it shrieks at the same volume as a jet plane.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Usually, its cries are like quiet murmurs. If frightened, it shrieks at the same volume as a jet plane.
